articles.title: Talks Held between Ministry of Oil Industry, Gazprom of Russia Delegations
articles.content:
Talks Held between Ministry of Oil Industry, Gazprom of Russia Delegations
Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) --Talks between the delegation of the Ministry of Oil Industry of the DPRK and the delegation of Gazprom of Russia were held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday. 
					 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were Minister of Oil Industry Kim Hui Yong, officials concerned and from the Russian side members of the delegation of Gazprom of Russia headed by its Deputy Managing Chairman Alexandr Ananenkov.
					
					 At the talks both sides discussed cooperation in oil and gas and a series of other issues of bilateral concern.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Visits Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Visits Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The visiting delegation of Gazprom of Russia led by Deputy Managing Chairman Alexandr Ananenkov laid a wreath at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong Tuesday.
					  The members of the delegation observed a moment's silence in memory of the revolutionary martyrs who dedicated their precious lives to the liberation and prosperity of the country and the accomplishment of the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 They also laid bouquets before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero.
					
					 On the same day, the delegation placed a wreath and bouquets before the Liberation Tower.
					
					 It paid a silent tribute to the Soviet Army soldiers who fell in the battles to liberate Korea.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation to Pay Official Goodwill Visit to China
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation to Pay Official Goodwill Visit to China
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- A friendship delegation of the DPRK headed by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, will soon pay an official goodwill visit to China at the invitation of the government of the People's Republic of China.
					 It will take part in the celebrations of the 50th anniversary of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Malawi
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Malawi
Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Bingu Wa Mutharika, president of Malawi, on the 47th anniversary of its independence. 
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will grow stronger, Kim in the message wished for development and prosperity of Malawi.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Visit to Mongolia Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Visit to Mongolia Observed
Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- A film show was held at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club Tuesday to mark the 55th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's visit to Mongolia and the 90th anniversary of the victory in the Mongolian people's revolution.
					Present there on invitation were Ambassador Sodovjamts Khurelbaatar and staff members of the Mongolian embassy here.
					
					Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and chairman of the DPRK-Mongolia Friendship Association, members of the Association and working people in the city were on hand.
					
					The participants watched the Korean documentary film "President Kim Il Sung Meets Foreign Heads of State and Prominent Figures" (Part 6) and Mongolian documentary "Inspiring Mongolia". 
					
					A friendly gathering with staff members of the Mongolian embassy took place at DPRK-Mongolia Friendship Pyongyang Songyo Secondary School on the same day.
					
					Present on invitation were the ambassador and staff members of the embassy.
					
					Jong Yong Jin and members of the Association and teachers and students of the school were on hand.
					
					After being briefed on the history of the school, the guests toured education facilities.
					
					They enjoyed an art performance given by students and talked with each other about the need to boost the friendly relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Provincial Rallies Condemn Crimes of Lee Myung Bak Group of Worst Traitors
articles.content:
Provincial Rallies Condemn Crimes of Lee Myung Bak Group of Worst Traitors
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Army-people rallies took place in South Phyongan, Jagang and North Hamgyong provinces to condemn the crimes of the Lee Myung Bak group of the worst traitors.
					 They were attended by leading officials of local party, power organs and working people's organizations and service persons of the Korean People's Army and people from all walks of life and youth and students.
					
					 The statement issued by a spokesman for the Supreme Command of the KPA was read out there to be followed by speeches. 
					
					 The speakers branded the provocations made by the confrontation maniacs stunning the world as reckless moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK and vehemently denounced the Lee Myung Bak group for them.
					
					 Our sacred retaliatory war will lead to a sacred war for reunification for making a clean sweep of the group of traitors with whom the nation can never live under the same sky and accomplishing the historic cause of national reunification, they declared.
					
					 They stated that it is the faith and grit of the army and people in the DPRK to react to provocation with stern punishment and to a war with a merciless sacred retaliatory war.
					
					 We will single-mindedly unite around the headquarters of the revolution, cherishing the immutable truth that we will always emerge victorious thanks to Kim Jong Il, peerless Songun brilliant commander, and firmly defend the best Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses, they declared.

articles.title: Korean People Pledge to Turn out in Sacred Retaliatory War
articles.content:
Korean People Vow Retaliation against S. Korean Regime
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- On receiving the recently released statements of the spokesmen for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army and the DPRK government, people of all social strata find it hard to repress their towering resentment at the south Korean regime for its grave provocations.
					 They are renewing their pledge to turn out in a sacred retaliatory war.
					
					 Minister of Agriculture Ri Kyong Sik told KCNA that those who hurt the social system and dignity of the DPRK will never remain unpunished. As already warnings were served, the DPRK will make a clean sweep of the south Korean traitors through a sacred retaliatory war involving the whole army, people and the nation, he added.
					
					 A vice-chairwoman of the Central Committee of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea, Kim Myong Suk, said the Korean women will join in the sacred war against the enemies.
					
					 Ri Won Il, chairman of the North Hwanghae Provincial People's Committee, said the enemies should clearly know that the decision of the army and people of the DPRK is not rhetoric.
					
					 Vice-president of the State Academy of Sciences Ri Song Uk said the Lee regime dared perpetrate grave provocations risking war. The army and people of the country will react to the enemy's provocation with a stern punishment and counter its war with a merciless sacred retaliatory war, he added.
					
					 Ri Mun Chang, an official in charge of the construction of the Huichon Power Station, declared that those who slandered the socialist system of the DPRK deserve a stern punishment from the nation.

articles.title: Agricultural Workers Commemorate Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Agricultural Workers Commemorate Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Agricultural workers' remembrance event "The Fatherly Leader Is with Us on Cooperative Farm Field Visited by Bumper Harvest" was held in Kumdang-ri, Onchon County Tuesday on the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Chairman of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Working People Ri Myong Gil referred to the immortal exploits the President performed by projecting the peasants as the master of the land, the master of the country, saying that agriculture is the mainstay of the country, and turning the countryside into modern socialist rural areas good to live in. 
					
					 Still fresh in the memory of the Korean people is the image of the kind-hearted President walking along passes between fields with so much effort to settle the problem of food for people and enable the peasants to live well, the speaker stressed.
					
					 The floor was taken then by Rim Gwang Uk, chairman of the Management Board of the Okdo Cooperative Farm, Ryonggang County, and Ri In Sun, chairwoman of the Union of Agricultural Working People at the Oryu Vegetable Cooperative Farm, Sadong District, Pyongyang, and others. They told touching stories about the noble personality of the President who visited fields in various parts of the country, leaving legends about his loving care.
					
					  Kim Hui Song, farmer of the Sohwa Cooperative Farm, Onchon County, and other speakers recalled that General Secretary Kim Jong Il has given energetic guidance, turning the rural areas associated with the efforts made by the President all his life into a socialist fairy land. 
					
					 Put on the stage at the event were such songs as "There is no such man as the leader", "The General is identical to the leader" and "It's the way guerrillas did, appearing in the east and then in the west."

articles.title: Chief of Russian Academy Ensemble Hopes for Korean People's Greater Success
articles.content:
Chief of Russian Academy Ensemble Hopes for Korean People's Greater Success
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- I wish the Korean people greater success in their drive to build a thriving nation, said Viktor Yeliseev, chief of the Academy Ensemble of the Interior Unit of the Russian Ministry of Interior, when interviewed by KCNA Monday before his departure from the DPRK.
					 I visited the DPRK with boundless reverence for General Secretary Kim Jong Il and feelings of friendship towards the Korean people, he said, and went on:
					
					 The Korean people have won only victories thanks to the outstanding leaders.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung made an immortal contribution to the development of the Russia-DPRK friendship.
					
					 He was the great leader of the people who devoted his all to the prosperity of the country and its people's happiness.
					
					 His cause has been successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He has devotedly worked for the prosperity of the country. He is boundlessly revered by the Korean people. The world is admired by their profound respect, veneration and absolute trust in him. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il watched our performance several times. 
					
					 He has profound knowledge about arts. I was struck with admiration at his inborn disposition. He is, indeed, a great master of arts. Arts are developing in the DPRK day by day thanks to his leadership.
					
					 Great changes are taking place in the DPRK under his wise leadership.
					
					 During our stay we witnessed its development.
					
					 We felt joyful here in the DPRK which we love so much.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Japanese Public Figure
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Japanese Public Figure
Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Sumiko Shimizu, chairwoman of the Japanese preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and representative of the Japanese Women's Society for Solidarity with the Korean Women, said after visiting the DPRK:
					 I can never forget those days when I had the honor of being received by President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 I paid my first visit to the DPRK in 1972. 
					
					 I was deeply moved to witness the reality of the DPRK. 
					
					 All the people were busy energetically pushing forward socialist construction, united close around the President. 
					
					 President Kim Il Sung, busy as he was with state affairs, received me and my party, fathoming our wishes. 
					
					 He warmly shook the hand of each of us, his face beaming with a broad smile.
					
					 We were excited by his kind-hearted personality. 
					
					 The President personally received us whenever we visited the DPRK in the subsequent period, too.
					
					 Each time I was received, I deeply felt he was the great leader of the people. 
					
					   He was, indeed, a great man possessed of ardent patriotism and humanity as his inborn disposition and an eternal leader of progressive mankind. 
					
					 His life was a life of the most distinguished great man who made an immortal contribution to accomplishing the human cause of independence. 
					
					 Human history knows no such leader as President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 He will always be alive in the hearts of all people as the smiling President just as the sun shines eternally.

articles.title: Collections of Poems off Press
articles.content:
Collections of Poems off Press
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The Korea Literature and Art Publishing House recently brought out new collections of poems. 
					 Among them is At the Head of Progress, the ninth part of Following the Sun of the 21st Century. It contains more than 50 poems on great feats Kim Jong Il performed in bringing about signal changes in the country with his Songun (military-first) leadership. 
					
					 The poems give a truthful representation of the Korean army and people making a progress in building a thriving nation, united close around the Workers' Party of Korea headed by Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Other collections are Song and Life written by Kim Jae Won, Rich Harvest by So Jin Myong and Echo of Life by Kim Hwi Jo.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Plan to Develop Islands in West Sea under Signboard of "Tourism" under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Plan to Develop Islands in West Sea under Signboard of "Tourism" under Fire
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces are vociferating about the "comprehensive plan for the development of the five islands in the West Sea." This indicates that they are becoming craftier and more vicious in their moves to escalate confrontation with fellow countrymen under the signboard of "tourism."
					 Minju Joson Tuesday says this in a by-lined commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The five islands in the West Sea and the waters around them are used by the puppet forces as their advanced base to ignite a war of aggression against the DPRK.
					
					 It was exactly in that place where they fabricated the "Cheonan" warship sinking case and were hit hard while preempting shelling at the DPRK defying its repeated warnings.
					
					 It is needless to say that the five islands including Paekryong and Yonphyong Islands and the waters around them are not suitable for tourist destinations as they are fraught with constant danger of armed conflicts.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group's attempt to turn them into international tourist destinations despite this hard reality is not to make money and encourage those islanders who left them to come back there.
					
					 Lurking behind the above-said plan is to bring tourists there in a bid to justify and step up its moves to launch a war of aggression against the DPRK through false propaganda.
					
					 Through the above-said plan the puppet forces also seek to make the "northern limit line" an established fact.
					
					 The gravity of its tourist projects lies in that the group seeks to use the islanders and tourists as "human shields" in the confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 Only the nation's stern punishment awaits the Lee group keen to use even tourism for the purpose of escalating the confrontation with compatriots.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Songun Politics of WPK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Songun Politics of WPK
Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The Songun politics pursued by the Workers' Party of Korea is a powerful political mode under socialism. It helps develop the People's Army into a matchless army to defend the country and build up a powerful driving force of the revolution with the army as the core and a model and dynamically push ahead with the overall socialist construction with the army as a mainstay of the revolution.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a by-lined article.
					
					 The WPK's Songun politics serves as a weapon for winning sure victory as it helps provide a military guarantee and remarkably strengthen the driving force for building a thriving nation, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 Under the banner of Songun the revolutionary ranks of the DPRK have developed into the ranks of human bullets and bombs devotedly defending the leader and a powerful driving force in which the army and people form an integral whole in idea and fighting spirit.
					
					 The WPK's Songun politics serves as an engine for creation and leap forward as it helps create a speed of the onward movement for a great surge and bring about an epochal turn in all domains of building a thriving nation.
					
					 The People's Army always stands in the van of creating world-startling miracles and feats in the DPRK.
					
					 The people in the DPRK keenly realize through the present stirring reality that the Songun politics is a powerful driving force for bringing earlier the victory in the drive for a great surge.

articles.title: S. Korean Group's Provocation against DPRK Flailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Group's Provocation against DPRK Flailed
Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean conservative group's recent serious provocations against the DPRK are its last-ditch efforts to evade ruin and escalate north-south confrontation, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a bylined article.
					 The anti-DPRK confrontation row kicked up by the group is aimed to justify and press for its worn-out "policy toward the north", the article says.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group's "policy toward the north", which bedeviled the north-south relations, is now on the verge of bankruptcy. During its term of office the group pursued one-sided "north policy" escalating confrontation.
					
					 The recent hideous provocations by the group were prompted by its criminal attempt to incite the consciousness of north-south confrontation and fan up hostile atmosphere in a bid to justify its confrontation policy.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime's traitorous policy is strongly rebuffed by the people.
					
					 The group, driven into a tight corner, plans to incite the hostility toward the fellow countrymen and divert elsewhere the attention of the angered people.
					
					 No one knows what reckless adventure this group will launch.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that nuclear holocaust will be inflicted on this land if the group is allowed to commit hideous provocations against the DPRK.

articles.title: Guidelines for Developing Songun Idea
articles.content:
Guidelines for Developing Songun Idea
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Socialism has steadily developed in the DPRK, propelled by Songun (military-first) politics pursued by the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Songun politics, formulated to be an effective socialist political mode by General Secretary Kim Jong Il, has fully demonstrated its validity and vitality in the Korean revolution. 
					
					 On July 5, Juche 90 (2001), he published a celebrated work "Songun Politics of Our Party Is an Effective Socialist Political Mode", in which he systematizes the WPK's Songun revolutionary line and Songun politics in an integral way and expounds them in a comprehensive way.
					
					 The work defines President Kim Il Sung's history of leadership as the history of the Songun-based leadership. On the basis of his Songun idea, it clarifies the essence, principles and contents of Songun politics and gives the tasks for implementing the politics. 
					
					 Contained in the work are new, unique ideas and theories, including the fundamentals of the Songun-based revolution, the principle of putting the army ahead of the working class and the idea of achieving unity of the army and civilians in ideology and working spirit.
					
					 The work proves the advantages of Songun politics and serves as guidelines for developing the Songun idea.

articles.title: Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (2)
articles.content:
Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (2)
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- This is a story about the close relationship between Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il and soldiers of the Korean People's Army. 
					 Kim Jong Il always remembers the soldier-builders who were at repair work inside Mujigae (rainbow) Tunnel whom he acquainted himself while passing through it during his long journey for Songun leadership during the Arduous March. 
					
					 At that time they were having their meals in darkness. So he told his chauffeur to stop the car despite the pressure of his time and turn its headlights on to lighten the dark tunnel for 15 minutes. These were a historic time when he openheartedly learned about the soldiers. This represented the world of the closest relationship between the Supreme Commander and his soldiers pervaded with sincerity.
					
					 His warm loving care for the soldiers immensely touched the army and people of the country and the then soldier-builders, in particular.
					
					 The soldier-builders did not know details of the great loving care shown to them by the Supreme Commander at that time. This has since been conveyed as an immortal legend. They are now studying at universities and party schools to prepare themselves as servants for the people, single-mindedly determined to live and struggle in the revolutionary soldier spirit and always remain loyal to the Supreme Commander.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Asserts Rev. Han's Innocence
articles.content:
South Korean Organization Asserts Rev. Han's Innocence
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean "Society for Preserving June 15 Joint Declaration and Peace and Protecting Rev. Han Sang Ryol" at a press conference on June 30 asserted the innocence of Rev. Han Sang Ryol, pro- reunification champion. 
					 The press release read out at the conference recalled that the Seoul High Court at a trial on appeal made by Rev. Han declared him guilty.
					
					 It denounced the high court for making its decision for the mere reason that he called for the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea during his visit to the north last year.
					
					 The press release noted that his call for the implementation of the above-said declarations is not the assertion of the north but a joint agreement made by the south and the north. It was an action against reunification that the authorities charged him with "sympathy with the north" for the mere reason he called for the implementation of the declarations.
					
					 It dismissed the recent ruling as totally null and void as it was the decision which infringed upon the freedom of expression in denial of the declarations.
					
					 People of various circles will launch a more dynamic movement for reunification to force the court to declare Rev. Han not guilty, declared the press release.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Anti-Worker Policy Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Anti-Worker Policy Flayed
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Teachers Union in a commentary on July 1 denounced the authorities' anti-worker policy.
					 The commentary recalled that the Minimum Wage Committee on June 29 set forth a negotiating proposal for deciding the minimum wage for 2012 at the tacit agreement with the management side. 
					
					 Even this proposal calls for infringing upon the elementary right to existence of the workers suffering destitution and pain due to low wage, it deplored, and continued:
					
					 The said committee, in the final analysis, has whiled away time not to help workers get higher pay but just to read the face of the management side.
					
					 Noting that the demands of the workers have not been reflected at all in the minimum wage level since the present regime appeared, the commentary said the committee and the management side can never shirk off the blame for having made a mockery of the workers.
					
					 It urged the committee to retract the above-said proposal at once and raise their wages.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Blocking Media Exchange
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Blocking Media Exchange
						
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The Press Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration on July 1 issued a statement titled "We strongly protest Lee Myung Bak regime's ban on exchange in media between south and north".
					 We can not repress wrath at the Lee "government" for having blocked media exchange between the south and the north, the statement said, urging that exchange and cooperation in media should be realized without fail for the peaceful reunification of the nation.
					
					 The "government" brought the inter-Korean relations to the brink of a total war through its unilateral "policy toward the north" in negation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, it charged.
					
					 Moreover, the authorities put a total ban on inter-Korean cooperation and exchange not only in media but also between NGOs under the pretext of the "May 24 step", it pointed out.
					
					 Media exchange is essential for cooperation and exchange in various fields including politics, economy and culture, it noted.
					
					 The statement urged the Lee "government" to stop at once such actions obstructive to the peaceful reunification movement of nation as ban on media exchange.

articles.title: Seminar on Kim Il Sung's Feats Held
articles.content:
Seminar on Kim Il Sung's Feats Held
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- A national seminar was held in Conakry, Guinea on June 25 on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung. 
					On display in its venue were works of Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and the photos on their exploits.
					
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said in a report at the seminar that Kim Il Sung fathered the Juche idea, clearly indicating the way of carving out the destiny of human beings. The exploits the President performed by providing mankind with a beacon indicating the road of independence and progress will shine forever, he added.
					
					 He recalled that the President extended firm solidarity to the peoples of those countries aspiring after independence and positively supported their struggle both materially and morally.
					
					 The floor was taken then by Boubakar Diakite, vice-chairman of the above-said committee, Abdoulaye Diallo, chairman of the Guinean Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea, and other personages.
					
					 The speakers spoke highly of the revolutionary life of the President who performed the immortal feats for the Korean revolution and the human cause of independence and the dynamic struggle being waged by the Korean people to build a thriving nation under the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet Homepage of  Regional Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet Homepage of Regional Organization
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions posted on its internet homepage the whole text of President Kim Il Sung's work "Go All Out for Victory in the War" on June 26.
					 The work, published on June 26, Juche 39 (1950), clarifies that the Fatherland Liberation War is a war of justice for achieving the reunification and independence of the country, freedom and democracy. It also indicates the tasks for winning a final victory in the war.

articles.title: Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea Called for by Peruvian Organization
articles.content:
Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea Called for by Peruvian Organization
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian preparatory committee for the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung issued a bulletin under the title "Let Us Achieve the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea" on the occasion of the month of international solidarity with the Korean people.
					 The bulletin in an article said that the peoples of many countries in the world who are supporting the cause of the Korean people are becoming increasingly vocal demanding the reunification of Korea and the democratization of the south Korean society.
					
					 The bulletin stressed that the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea and the dismantlement of nuclear weapons are the prerequisite for the reunification of Korea.
					
					 The bulletin accused the U.S. of dreaming of stifling socialist Korea, turning its face away from the DPRK's proposal for replacing the armistice agreement with a peace agreement.
					
					 The DPRK is victoriously pushing ahead with the building of a great prosperous and powerful nation and the movement for national reunification, smashing all plots of the hostile forces, as it holds General Secretary Kim Jong Il in high esteem and is led by the Workers' Party of Korea, bulletin said, and continued:
					
					 The unity of the leader, the party, army and the people is the most important factor that guarantees the victory of socialist Korea.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Observed in Brazil and Colombia
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of  Kim Il Sung Observed in Brazil and Colombia
Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The organizations of Brazil and Colombia issued bulletins on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Brazil-Korea Friendship Association in its bulletin edited an article titled "The Eternal Song Sung by People" on June 28.
					
					 The bulletin carried the words of the immortal revolutionary paean "Song of General Kim Il Sung." This song was created in reflection of all Koreans' feelings praising Kim Il Sung in the period of building a new country, it noted.
					
					 The bulletin said that Kim Il Sung indicated the way for the liberated Korean people to follow and built the people's country, the first of its kind in the nation's history spanning 5 000 years.
					
					 The President is always alive with the "Song of General Kim Il Sung" which always resounds forth in the DPRK.
					
					 The Group for the Study of the Juche Idea "Kanggye" of Colombia noted in an article of its bulletin titled "Popular President" that the President defeated the Japanese imperialists thanks to the devoted love and support of the people without getting any support from a state rear or from a regular army and accomplished the historic cause of national liberation. 
					
					 The bulletin edited the anecdotes showing the popular traits of the President who dedicated himself to the happiness of the people, not asking for any privilege or special benefit.

articles.title: China Celebrates CPC Anniversary
articles.content:
China Celebrates CPC Anniversary
 Beijing, July 4 (KCNA) -- A national employees' calligraphic pieces exhibition was opened at the Working People's Cultural Palace in Beijing on June 28 to celebrate the 90th anniversary of the Communist Party of China (CPC).
					 It was co-sponsored by the All-China Federation of Trade Unions, the Association of Calligraphers of China and the Association of Employee Calligraphers of China.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the All-China Federation of Trade Unions who is also the first secretary of its Secretariat said the exhibition of calligraphic pieces reflecting historical details and distinct trend of the times is aimed to demonstrate the firm faith and determination of the Chinese working class to share intention with the party and follow it to the last.

articles.title: Chinese Vice-Premier Calls for Agricultural Progress
articles.content:
Chinese Vice-Premier Calls for Agricultural Progress 
 Beijing, July 4 (KCNA) -- Hui Liangyu, vice-premier of the State Council of China, called for speedy and excellent progress of rural economy and society.
					 He made this call while visiting the exhibition of agricultural policies, adopted since the birth of the Communist Party of China, at the Agricultural Exhibition Hall in Beijing.
					
					 For the past 90 years since its foundation the CPC has attached big importance to agriculture, farms and farmers and made efforts to solve them, thereby successfully paving the way for victory of the neo-democratic revolution and development of the socialist cause.
					
					 He stressed the need to maintain the party's basic agricultural policy to win a fresh victory in building a comprehensively well-off society and provide a sure guarantee for stepping up the cause of socialism with the Chinese characteristics.

articles.title: China Ready to Work for Rural Women's Rights with Other Countries
articles.content:
China Ready to Work for Rural Women's Rights with Other Countries
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- China is ready to join hands with countries in the world to work for the rights and interests of rural women, China's Minister of Agriculture Han Changfu said at the 37th Session of FAO Conference.
					 He said that the Chinese government attaches great importance to the protection of women, protection of rural women's rights and interests in particular. It is providing the women with opportunities and rights to develop on an equal footing by taking various steps in law, administration, and economy and other aspects, he added.

articles.title: Russia, Belarus, Kazakhstan Close Border Customhouses
articles.content:
Russia, Belarus, Kazakhstan Close Border Customhouses
Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Russia, Belarus and Kazakhstan, member states of the Customs Union, closed all border customhouses among its members from July 1.
					 Under this step, customs control over commodities and transport means moving into the territory of the Union will be made at transit points in boundaries outside the Union by customs authorities of its member states.
					
					 This is reportedly the start of the second stage of the Union's action.

articles.title: Russia Works to Develop Relations with CIS Member Nations
articles.content:
Russia Works to Develop Relations with CIS Member Nations
 Moscow, July 4 (KCNA) -- The head of the Presidential Administration of Russia recently expressed the country's stand to develop cooperation and partnership with the member nations of the Commonwealth of Independent States.
					 Over the past 20 years the CIS has turned into the one and only regional body helpful to solving the key issues for development of its member nations, he said.
					
					 Russia will further develop the relations of cooperation and partnership with CIS member nations, he declared.

articles.title: Russian FM Criticizes US Interference
articles.content:
Russian FM Criticizes US Interference
 Moscow, July 4 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, speaking at a meeting of the International Affairs Committee of the State Duma on June 30, rejected the U.S. interference in the internal affairs of Russia.
					 U.S. Congress recently deliberated on a resolution on imposing sanctions on several personages of Russia, including members of its armed forces organ, over the case of a lawyer who died during preliminary examination in Russia.
					
					 Lavrov rejected this behavior as interference in his country's internal affairs.
					
					 Such behavior of some U.S. congressmen can never be pardoned as it is an act of totally ignoring the investigation into the case to which the Russian authorities are paying attention, he said.

articles.title: Mongolian PM Calls for Strengthened Cooperation among News Agencies
articles.content:
Mongolian PM Calls for Strengthened Cooperation among News Agencies
						
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Mongolian Prime Minister Sukhbaataryn Batbold called for intensifying cooperation among news agencies. He made this call at the meeting of the OANA Executive Committee on June 28.
					 The news agencies have played an important role in the history of each country and this importance remains unchanged, he said.
					
					 It is pride of journalists to inform the world of regional achievements and development and convey home and foreign news to the regional people, he said, stressing that it is more important to intensify cooperation among news agencies at present.

articles.title: Iran Ridicules Western Sanctions
articles.content:
Iran Ridicules Western Sanctions
						
 Tehran, July 4 (KCNA) -- A senior commander of Islamic Revolution Guard Corps of Iran said Thursday the western sanctions have had no impact on Iran's military advancements.
					 However, the western campaign of threats and sanctions against Iran has made the nation "more proficient, conscious and determined," and "it has made the armed forces more effective in the battlefield," he noted.
					
					 He said Iran's armed forces will make the enemies regret with "a crushing, fatal and chastising" response if they dare to act out their war threats.
					
					"We will not allow any impairment to the security and sovereignty of the Islamic Republic," he said.

articles.title: Azerbaijani President Calls for Palestinian Independent State
articles.content:
Azerbaijani President Calls for Palestinian Independent State
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev in a press conference on June 28 called for immediately building an independent state of Palestine.
					 An independent and sovereign state of Palestine should be built at an early date with East Kuds as its capital, he said, adding this is the stand of the Azerbaijani government and, accordingly, his country adheres to this stand at all the international bodies.
					
					 This stand is the fraternal duty of Azerbaijan and, at same time, it is based on international laws, he stressed.

articles.title: Palestine Slams US Unreasonable Resolution
articles.content:
Palestine Slams US Unreasonable Resolution
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Nabil Shaath, a Palestinian peace negotiator, on Thursday slammed the unreasonable resolution of the U.S. Senate.
					 Resolution 185, passed Wednesday, called on the U.S. President Barack Obama to veto the UN vote on the Palestinian request for recognition of their state in September.
					
					 This is a shameful decision for the U.S. styling itself a "peace mediator", said Nabil Shaath. He urged the U.S. to cancel the wrong resolution threatening and blackmailing Palestinians.

articles.title: US Forces' Projected Military Exercises in Japan Flailed
articles.content:
US Forces' Projected Military Exercises in Japan Flailed
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- The Kagoshima Prefectural Assembly of Japan on June 28 adopted a written opinion opposing the plan to stage in Make Island of the prefecture taking-off and landing drill by deck planes of aircraft carrier of the U.S. forces in Japan.
					 The planned transfer of the drill place to the island goes against its authorities' will, the opinion said, adding that the assembly can never accept the attitude of the government which has not given the local authorities understandable explanation on it.
					
					 That day the mayor of Nishinoomote of the island and others called at the Defense Ministry to hand a written protest, which urges the cancellation of article on the transfer of the drill to Make Island from the joint document adopted between the Japanese and the U.S. governments.
					
					The joint document can never be approved as it disregarded the opinion of the locality, the written protest said.

articles.title: Businesses in Japan Face Stagnation
articles.content:
Businesses in Japan Face Stagnation
						
 Pyongyang, July 5 (KCNA) -- Many businesses in Japan are in serious depression due to the continued economic stagnation.
					 Business confidence among Japan's largest manufacturers dropped sharply in the three months to June from the previous quarter, the Bank of Japan said in a report on Friday.

articles.title: Sobre visita oficial a China de delegacion de amistad de RPDC
articles.content:
Sobre visita oficial a China de delegacion de amistad de RPDC
Pyongyang, 5 de julio (ATCC) -- Por invitacion del gobierno de la Republica Popular China (RPCh), la delegacion de amistad de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea (RPDC) presidida por Yang Hyong Sop, vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, realizara pronto una visita oficial y de amistad a la RPCh para participar en los actos conmemorativos del 50o aniversario de la concertacion del acuerdo de amistad, cooperacion y ayuda mutua Corea-China.

articles.title: Coreanos se levantaran como un solo en la batalla de represalia
articles.content:
Coreanos se levantaran como un solo en la batalla de represalia
Pyongyang, 5 de julio (ATCC) -- Al enterarse de las declaraciones de portavoces de la Comandancia Suprema del Ejercito Popular de Corea y del gobierno de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, los trabajadores de distintos estratos expresan la indignacion por el proceder histerico de la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak y toman la decision de levantarse como un solo hombre en la sagrada batalla de represalia pannacional para castigar a los traidores surcoreanos.
					　Ri Kyong Sik, ministro de Agricultura, senalo que los que denigran el sistema y la dignidad de la Republica no podran existir jamas en esta tierra, y apunto que como ya han advertido, todo el ejercito y todo el pueblo libraran una sagrada lucha de represalia para aniquilar completamente a la banda de los traidores.
					
					　La vicepresidenta del Comite Central de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea, Kim Myong Suk, destaco que las mujeres coreanas daran golpes de venganza a los traidores y no dejaran la sagrada lucha hasta cuando se aniquilen completamente los enemigos. 
					
					　Ri Won Il, presidente del Comite Popular de la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte, apunto que los enemigos deben darse clara cuenta de que no es una palabra vana la determinacion de nuestro ejercito y el pueblo.
					
					　Ri Song Uk, vicepresidente de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias, recalco que dado que la banda del traidor Lee cometio atrevidamente una provocacion extremada que pueda convertirse en la guerra, nuestro ejercito y pueblo estan dispuestos para responder a las provocaciones con el castigo rotundo, y a la guerra con la sagrada batalla de represalia despiadada.
					
					　Ri Mun Chang, jefe de la brigada de Ryongsan para la construccion de la Central Hidroelectrica de Huichon, preciso que seran condenados por la nacion  los bribones que niegan el prestigioso regimen socialista coreano e insultan hasta la maxima dignidad de la RPDC.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia campana conflictiva de banda de MB
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia campana conflictiva de banda de MB
　Pyongyang, 5 de julio (ATCC) -- El diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual de hoy califico las recientes provocaciones de la banda de traidores del Sur de Corea contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea de un esfuerzo desesperado para eludir la crisis de ruina y agravar mas la confrontacion fratricida.
					　Los conservadores surcoreanos se entregan a la campana conflictiva contra la RPDC a fin de  justificar y seguir practicando su  vieja "politica sobre el Norte", comienza el articulista y continua:
					
					　La "politica sobre el Norte" de la camarilla de Lee, que llevo al fracaso las relaciones Norte-Sur, esta en peligro inminente de fracaso. En el periodo de su mandato los titeres han armado de continuo los alborotos anti-RPDC aferrandose solo a la unilateral "politica sobre el Norte" caracterizada de enfrentamiento.
					
					　Las actuales provocaciones de la banda de Lee parten de la intencion criminal encaminada a justificar la politica conflictiva y llevarla a cabo hasta el fin creando la conciencia de enfrentamiento y el ambiente  hostil contra la RPDC.
					
					　Ahora, la politica traidora del "poder" de Lee Myung Bak tropieza con una fuerte resistencia de los habitantes.
					
					　La banda de Lee intenta desviar la indignada opinion publica sembrando la conciencia hostil contra sus connacionales.
					
					　Nadie sabe cuando y como se aventuraria a provocar contra la RPDC la banda de Lee arrinconada por la peor crisis.
					
					　Si se permiten tales perversas maquinaciones de provocacion anti-RPDC de la banda de Lee, se desataria en esta tierra la guerra nuclear.

articles.title: Personalidad japonesa recuerda el encuentro con Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Personalidad japonesa recuerda el encuentro con Kim Il Sung
　Pyongyang, 5 de julio (ATCC) -- Durante su reciente visita a Corea, Sumiko Shimizu, presidenta del comite preparatorio japones para el centenario del natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung y representante del Consejo de Enlace de Mujeres de Japon para la Solidaridad con las Mujeres Coreanas, expreso el testimonio de su gran veneracion al Presidente.
					  No puedo olvidar nunca mis encuentros con el Presidente Kim Il Sung, comenzo ella y prosiguio:
					
					  Mi primera visita a Corea fue en 1972 y entonces me quede profundamente impresionada de las realidades de este pais.
					
					  Todo el pueblo coreano impulsaba la construccion del socialismo unido firmemente en torno al Presidente.
					
					  Aunque estaba muy ocupado de los asuntos estatales, el recibio a mi comitiva y estrecho la mano con cada una de nosotras esbozando una sonrisa.
					
					  Realmente, estuvimos muy emocionadas de su imagen generosa.
					
					  Posteriormente, tuvimos el honor de ser recibidas por el cada vez que visitamos a Corea.
					
					  En cada encuentro, constate que el era gran lider del pueblo.
					
					  El es gran hombre caracterizado por las cualidades como patriotismo y humanismo y Lider eterno de la humanidad progresista.
					
					  Durante su vida, el hizo un aporte indeleble al cumplimiento de la causa de verificacion de la independencia de la humanidad.
					
					  No hubo en la historia de la humanidad un lider comparable con el.
					
					  Al igual que el sol, el Presidente estara siempre presente en el corazon de todos los pueblos.
